commands.name: flow get test
commands.description: Display test results for a specific asynchronous test run.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

requiredFlags.name: --test-run-id
requiredFlags.description: ID of the test run. Provide a flow test run ID to display test results for an enqueued or completed asynchronous test run. The test run ID is displayed after running the "sf flow run test" command.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --code-coverage
optionalFlags.description: Retrieve code coverage results. To see code coverage results, use the --code-coverage flag with --result-format. The output displays a high-level summary of the test run and the code coverage values for flow tests in your org. If you specify human-readable result format, use the --detailed-coverage flag to see detailed coverage results for each test method run.

optionalFlags.name: --detailed-coverage
optionalFlags.description: Not available for flow tests.

optionalFlags.name: --output-dir
optionalFlags.description: Directory in which to store test result files.

optionalFlags.name: --result-format
optionalFlags.description: Format of the test results.

optionalFlags.name: --concise
optionalFlags.description: Display only failed test results; works with human-readable output only.

commands.name: flow run test
commands.description: Invoke flow tests in an org.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --result-format
optionalFlags.description: Format of the test results.

optionalFlags.name: --concise
optionalFlags.description: Display only failed test results; works with human-readable output only.

optionalFlags.name: --output-dir
optionalFlags.description: Directory in which to store test result files.

optionalFlags.name: --code-coverage
optionalFlags.description: Retrieve code coverage results. To see code coverage results, use the --code-coverage flag with --result-format. The output displays a high-level summary of the test run and the code coverage values for classes in your org. If you specify human-readable result format, use the --detailed-coverage flag to see detailed coverage results for each test method run.

optionalFlags.name: --synchronous
optionalFlags.description: Run flow tests for one flow synchronously; if not specified, tests are run asynchronously. By default, "flow run test" runs asynchronously and immediately returns a test run ID. If you use the -–synchronous flag, you can use the --wait flag to specify the number of minutes to wait; if the tests finish in that timeframe, the command displays the results. If the tests haven't finished by the end of the wait time, the command displays a test run ID. Use the "flow get test --test-run-id" command to get the results.

optionalFlags.name: --test-level
optionalFlags.description: Level of tests to run; default is RunLocalTests. Here's what the levels mean: RunLocalTests — All tests in your org are run, except the ones that originate from installed managed and unlocked packages. RunAllTestsInOrg — All tests are run. The tests include all tests in your org, including tests of managed packages. RunSpecifiedTests - Only the tests that you specify with the --tests flag are run.

optionalFlags.name: --class-names
optionalFlags.description: Flow names that contain flow tests to run. Default is all flow tests. If you select --class-names, you can't specify --tests. Specify which tests to run by using the --class-names flag followed by the names of the flows you want to test. For example, if you save a flow with the name Flow1, then use: --class-names Flow1.

optionalFlags.name: --suite-names
optionalFlags.description: Not available for flow tests.

optionalFlags.name: --tests
optionalFlags.description: Flow test names to run. Default is all flow tests. If you specify --tests, you can't specify --class-names.
